revision.text: {{WikiProject Judaism | class= start | importance= mid }} ===Missing the History of Kollelim=== The history of Kollelim in the [[Holy land]] which where supported by the European Jewery, divided by Regions is Missing. One should fill in correct histroy about Polish Kollel, Hongarian, Zibnbirgen, etc. ===Etymology=== The word "kollel" seems to me to be the same as the English word "college". Is it an old Hebrew word or did it come into Hebrew from a Germanic source, perhaps via Yiddish? [[User:Dodger67|Roger]] ([[User talk:Dodger67|talk]]) 14:24, 18 August 2008 (UTC) :I'm sorry, but this is not true. Kollel is a known Hebrew word with the definition explained at [[Kollel (disambiguation)]].[[User:HagiMalachi|HagiMalachi]] ([[User talk:HagiMalachi|talk]]) 18:27, 18 August 2008 (UTC) ::: You're not really answering my question. Maybe "College" came into English from Hebrew (via Latin "Collegium" of course) The similarity is just too close for there to be no relationship at all! [[User:Dodger67|Roger]] ([[User talk:Dodger67|talk]]) 22:32, 12 December 2009 (UTC) ==Listing of Kollel's== perhaps putting up an extensive list of kollels around the world is in order? —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Waky02|Waky02]] ([[User talk:Waky02|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Waky02|contribs]]) 11:15, 5 July 2009 (UTC) :-) there's literally thousands, with new small ones each day. Perhaps a list could be made of the more established and/or noteworthy ones, but maybe that would be a security risk??? —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/84.110.57.234|84.110.57.234]] ([[User talk:84.110.57.234|talk]]) 18:55, 12 December 2009 (UTC)
